trans-unit.source: Working with Navigation Properties in XML
trans-unit.target: Working with Navigation Properties in XML

trans-unit.source: Navigation properties are updated by specifying a link in the request body.
trans-unit.target: Navigation properties are updated by specifying a link in the request body.

trans-unit.source: They can be read either as objects or links.
trans-unit.target: They can be read either as objects or links.

trans-unit.source: The default media type for Graph API requests and responses is JSON Lite.
trans-unit.target: The default media type for Graph API requests and responses is JSON Lite.

trans-unit.source: If you want to send requests and receive responses in XML, use “application/xml” as the media type when working with navigation properties as links, and “application/atom+xml” when reading navigation properties as objects.
trans-unit.target: If you want to send requests and receive responses in XML, use “application/xml” as the media type when working with navigation properties as links, and “application/atom+xml” when reading navigation properties as objects.

trans-unit.source: All other aspects of the request – for example, the URI and the HTTP method -- remain the same as for a request specified in JSON.
trans-unit.target: All other aspects of the request – for example, the URI and the HTTP method -- remain the same as for a request specified in JSON.

trans-unit.source: Request Headers
trans-unit.target: Request Headers

trans-unit.source: The following table shows the headers that can be included in a request.
trans-unit.target: The following table shows the headers that can be included in a request.

trans-unit.source: To specify the request body as XML when updating navigation properties, you must include the <embeddedLabel>Content-Type</embeddedLabel> header and specify the media type as “application/xml” (updates to navigation properties can only be specified as links in the request header).
trans-unit.target: To specify the request body as XML when updating navigation properties, you must include the <embeddedLabel>Content-Type</embeddedLabel> header and specify the media type as “application/xml” (updates to navigation properties can only be specified as links in the request header).

trans-unit.source: To specify that a response be returned in XML, you must include the <embeddedLabel>Accept</embeddedLabel> header; specify the media type as “application/atom+xml” if objects are expected or “application/xml” if links are expected in the response.
trans-unit.target: To specify that a response be returned in XML, you must include the <embeddedLabel>Accept</embeddedLabel> header; specify the media type as “application/atom+xml” if objects are expected or “application/xml” if links are expected in the response.

trans-unit.source: Request Header
trans-unit.target: Request Header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Accept
trans-unit.target: Accept

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: The expected media type of the content in the response.
trans-unit.target: The expected media type of the content in the response.

trans-unit.source: The default is JSON-Lite.
trans-unit.target: The default is JSON-Lite.

trans-unit.source: Must be specified if XML is desired for the response.
trans-unit.target: Must be specified if XML is desired for the response.

trans-unit.source: Supported media types are application/json, application/atom+xml, or application/xml (for links in XML).
trans-unit.target: Supported media types are application/json, application/atom+xml, or application/xml (for links in XML).

trans-unit.source: Parameters may be included with the media type.
trans-unit.target: Parameters may be included with the media type.

trans-unit.source: Authorization
trans-unit.target: Authorization

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: A bearer token issued by Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: A bearer token issued by Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: See <legacyLink xlink:href="874839d9-6de6-43aa-9a5c-613b0c93247e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authentication Scenarios for Azure AD</legacyLink> for more information.
trans-unit.target: See <legacyLink xlink:href="874839d9-6de6-43aa-9a5c-613b0c93247e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authentication Scenarios for Azure AD</legacyLink> for more information.

trans-unit.source: Content-Type
trans-unit.target: Content-Type

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: The media type of the content in the request body.
trans-unit.target: The media type of the content in the request body.

trans-unit.source: Supported media types are application/json, application/atom+xml, or application/xml (for links in XML).
trans-unit.target: Supported media types are application/json, application/atom+xml, or application/xml (for links in XML).

trans-unit.source: Parameters may be included with the media-type.
trans-unit.target: Parameters may be included with the media-type.

trans-unit.source: Content-Length
trans-unit.target: Content-Length

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: The length of the request in bytes.
trans-unit.target: The length of the request in bytes.

trans-unit.source: Can be omitted if the request does not contain a body.
trans-unit.target: Can be omitted if the request does not contain a body.

trans-unit.source: Response Headers
trans-unit.target: Response Headers

trans-unit.source: The same response headers are returned by Graph API for both JSON and XML requests; however, the <embeddedLabel>Content-Type</embeddedLabel> value will be different.
trans-unit.target: The same response headers are returned by Graph API for both JSON and XML requests; however, the <embeddedLabel>Content-Type</embeddedLabel> value will be different.

trans-unit.source: For JSON responses this value will specify “application/json”, as the media type, and for XML responses it will specify either “application/atom+xml” or “application/xml” (for links) as the media type.
trans-unit.target: For JSON responses this value will specify “application/json”, as the media type, and for XML responses it will specify either “application/atom+xml” or “application/xml” (for links) as the media type.

trans-unit.source: The headers specific to Graph API are shown in the following table.
trans-unit.target: The headers specific to Graph API are shown in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Response Header
trans-unit.target: Response Header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: ocp-aad-diagnostics-server-name
trans-unit.target: ocp-aad-diagnostics-server-name

trans-unit.source: The identifier for the server that performed the requested operation.
trans-unit.target: The identifier for the server that performed the requested operation.

trans-unit.source: ocp-aad-session-key
trans-unit.target: ocp-aad-session-key

trans-unit.source: The key that identifies the current session with the directory service.
trans-unit.target: The key that identifies the current session with the directory service.

trans-unit.source: Example 1: Getting Group Members as Links
trans-unit.target: Example 1: Getting Group Members as Links

trans-unit.source: The following shows an XML request to get the members of a group as links.
trans-unit.target: The following shows an XML request to get the members of a group as links.

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>Accept</embeddedLabel> header is specified as “application/xml” because the group members will be returned as links.
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>Accept</embeddedLabel> header is specified as “application/xml” because the group members will be returned as links.

trans-unit.source: For details about the required URI and HTTP method, see <link xlink:href="7f4fe1ad-beaa-47d7-9cca-52c5b3992d64" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create User(s)</link>.
trans-unit.target: For details about the required URI and HTTP method, see <link xlink:href="7f4fe1ad-beaa-47d7-9cca-52c5b3992d64" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create User(s)</link>.

trans-unit.source: A successful operation returns an HTTP Status of <embeddedLabel>201 OK</embeddedLabel> and the URIs of the group members are returned in the response body.
trans-unit.target: A successful operation returns an HTTP Status of <embeddedLabel>201 OK</embeddedLabel> and the URIs of the group members are returned in the response body.

trans-unit.source: This group has a user and another group as members.
trans-unit.target: This group has a user and another group as members.

trans-unit.source: Example 2: Getting Group Members as Objects
trans-unit.target: Example 2: Getting Group Members as Objects

trans-unit.source: To get the members as objects remove the “$links” segment from the URI and specify “application/atom+xml” as the media type in the <embeddedLabel>Accept</embeddedLabel> header.
trans-unit.target: To get the members as objects remove the “$links” segment from the URI and specify “application/atom+xml” as the media type in the <embeddedLabel>Accept</embeddedLabel> header.

trans-unit.source: The following shows the response when the group members are returned as objects.
trans-unit.target: The following shows the response when the group members are returned as objects.

trans-unit.source: Example 3: Updating the Group members Property
trans-unit.target: Example 3: Updating the Group members Property

trans-unit.source: The following shows a request to update the members of a group.
trans-unit.target: The following shows a request to update the members of a group.

trans-unit.source: You must use links to update a navigation property.
trans-unit.target: You must use links to update a navigation property.

trans-unit.source: For this reason the media type is set to “application/xml” in the <embeddedLabel>Content-Type</embeddedLabel> header.
trans-unit.target: For this reason the media type is set to “application/xml” in the <embeddedLabel>Content-Type</embeddedLabel> header.

trans-unit.source: It’s set to the same media type in the <embeddedLabel>Accept</embeddedLabel> header, so that any error will be returned in XML.
trans-unit.target: It’s set to the same media type in the <embeddedLabel>Accept</embeddedLabel> header, so that any error will be returned in XML.

trans-unit.source: The request body takes a <embeddedLabel><uri></embeddedLabel> element that specifies the URI of the object to add to the group.
trans-unit.target: The request body takes a <embeddedLabel><uri></embeddedLabel> element that specifies the URI of the object to add to the group.

trans-unit.source: The XML namespace must be specified as shown for the <embeddedLabel><uri></embeddedLabel> element.
trans-unit.target: The XML namespace must be specified as shown for the <embeddedLabel><uri></embeddedLabel> element.

trans-unit.source: A successful operation returns <embeddedLabel>204 No Content</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: A successful operation returns <embeddedLabel>204 No Content</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Remarks
trans-unit.target: Remarks

trans-unit.source: For more information about the request URI to use and the parameters to send in the request body when performing specific operations on directory objects; see the appropriate topic under the applicable operations node, for example, under <link xlink:href="04d1e2e3-06b6-49c5-9f8c-514742f24b3f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Operations on Users</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the request URI to use and the parameters to send in the request body when performing specific operations on directory objects; see the appropriate topic under the applicable operations node, for example, under <link xlink:href="04d1e2e3-06b6-49c5-9f8c-514742f24b3f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Operations on Users</link>.

trans-unit.source: You can also find information about operations that can be performed on a specific directory type in the <link xlink:href="de7d4e09-243c-44d1-83ba-532662649081" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Entity and Type Reference</link>.
trans-unit.target: You can also find information about operations that can be performed on a specific directory type in the <link xlink:href="de7d4e09-243c-44d1-83ba-532662649081" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Entity and Type Reference</link>.

trans-unit.source: You cannot invoke directory service functions, such as <embeddedLabel>isMemberOf</embeddedLabel>, in XML.
trans-unit.target: You cannot invoke directory service functions, such as <embeddedLabel>isMemberOf</embeddedLabel>, in XML.

trans-unit.source: The examples above use the tenant domain to address the tenant.
trans-unit.target: The examples above use the tenant domain to address the tenant.

trans-unit.source: Instead of the domain, you can also use the tenant object ID or addressing aliases to address the tenant; for more information, see <link xlink:href="5b0f3e3d-f96e-4b5b-864d-fc7c6b185097" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Addressing Aliases</link>.
trans-unit.target: Instead of the domain, you can also use the tenant object ID or addressing aliases to address the tenant; for more information, see <link xlink:href="5b0f3e3d-f96e-4b5b-864d-fc7c6b185097" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Addressing Aliases</link>.
